isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL RIDE OPTIMIZED SUSPENSION (IROS) - REMOVE AND INSTALL - MAIN SUPPORT MEMBERS

note.para: When replacing main support members, it is recommended that you replace all hardware items also.

step1.para: Unload vehicle and block wheels to prevent vehicle from rolling. Raise vehicle frame 2 inches and support with floor stands. Place floor stand in position to support transverse crossmember in present position (to maintain position when spring U-bolts are removed).

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Remove wheel assembly from axle side being serviced. Refer to GROUP 17 - WHEELS in the Master Service Manual.
Exhaust air from vehicle and suspension system. Exhaust air by:

note.para: Even if air spring has a leak and is deflated, the air must still be exhausted from system.

step2.para: Automatic control - height control valve - disconnect link at lower connection, then rotate control arm to exhaust (approximately 45 degrees down) position.
Disconnect air supply line from air spring.

step1.para: Disconnect shock absorbers and air springs at lower end.
Disconnect torque rod at spring hangar end and remove spring pin from spring hangar. Also loosen rear torque rod mounting nuts (Do not normally need to be removed).
Remove lower shock absorber plate from transverse beam.
Remove spring U-bolts while supporting lower U-bolt plate and related parts. Remove and discard spring liner.
Inspect all parts for wear, cracks or failed welds. Repair or replace.

caution.para: Do not repair a cracked spring, U-bolt or spacer plates. The listed parts must be replaced if cracks are present

note.para: When tightening spring U-bolts, torque rod fasteners and other related mounting fasteners to specifications, the vehicle must be at proper ride height to avoid introducing unnecessary stress on the bushings. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for specified torque values.

step1.para: Position spring to approximate installed position (Figure 15, Items 2 and 3) and install the bar pin in hanger on the forward side of the spring hanger. Also install lower shock bracket end and do not tighten fasteners.
Place U-bolt seat on top of spring (Figure 19, Item 2) with tab towards vehicle frame then install U-bolt assembly to spring and axle. Do not tighten fasteners to specified values at this time.

At this point assemble the spring clamp group and main support member to the axle, align the suspension and tighten assembly. Tighten to specifications in the following sequence: U-bolts (tighten diagonally), (Figure 26) front torque rod nuts, rear torque rod nuts, and the lower shock absorber mounting plate on the transverse beam. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Connect lower air spring, shock absorbers and height control valve linkage and any air lines that were removed. Tighten all fasteners to values specified. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Install tires/wheels. Refer to GROUP 17 - WHEELS in the Master Service Manual.
Build vehicle air pressure to governor cutout pressure and use soap and water solution to check for leaks.
